item.title: Create self-signed certificate for Apache on one line
item.description:
You need to create a self-signed certificate for httpd server by Apache Software Foundation I guess. There are thousands of tutorials out there. But I have the special one. A oneliner. Yeah! Do the following in an empty directory, /tmp for example. openssl genrsa -out cert.key 1024 && echo -ne "




$HOSTNAME
root@$HOSTNAME
" | openssl req -new -key cert.key -x509 -out cert.crt -days 999 All done. Nasty, isn't it? You can check out your fresh certificate by issuing
